channel.title: What should I save my money torwards?
channel.description:
I'm applying for a job next week for walmart - radioshack and alot of other places :P since i'm the kind of guy that enjoys saving money untill i have enough to get what i want i'm going to try and save torwards one of these computers when i get a job. But that really has nothing to do with this question.
IF I was to save torwards a computer, money wise (not computer wise). What would be better? http://www.dell.com/us/en/home/desktops/alienware-area-51/pd.aspx?refid=alienware-area-51&s=dhs&cs=19
http://www.velocitymicro.com/wizard.php?iid=75

[quote=“Natey, post:7, topic:345536”]Buy a shitload of weed and blunt raps, maybe eve a pipe, some munchies, and call me up.[/quote]LOOL

  • Buy me tickets from UK to US
  • Let me join in.

item.title: What should I save my money torwards?

item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

if u dont have one already an ipod touch.

sure a new computer if its really necessary.

games for ur console?

or bike/skateboard/scooter if u have a hobby like that…

item.title: What should I save my money torwards?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Obviously you would be much better off building your own computer, when I built my last computer I spent $600, the same computer from dell.com cost $3000, so yea, you save a little bit.

yeah i’m actually doing that now at digitalstormonline.com
